Name: Spacefaring: For Fun & Profit
Description:
A brand new region of space has been discovered and it is brimming with planets ripe for the plundering. Blast off into uncharted territory and be the first to claim these curiously uninhabited wellsprings of wherewithal.

The goal of "Spacefaring: For Fun & Profit" is to colonize the most valuable planets before your rivals. The game ends as soon as every planet has been colonized, and your total score is based on your planet value, the number of factories you built and the economic level of your homeworld.

Name: Samarkand: Routes to Riches – Family Connection
Description:
Family ties are established even tighter now.  Being merchants, the players equip their sons and daughters with goods and gems and send them out to travel the trading routes.  The only thing still missing is the adequate partner.  Which marriage is most promising?

Components:

20 caravan children - 10 "sons" boards and 10 "daughters" boards
    15 neutral goods markers
    67 - gems (in 5 colors)
    10 coins
    10 son/daughter markers

Name: Strikeout
Description: Sister game to Touchdown (an American Football game). Game consists of a large board depicting a baseball diamond, batter and pitcher cards, some standup figures, D6 dice and a scorepad. Game mechanics consist of Pitcher choosing a pitch card, batter choosing a type of swing, both players rolling a D6 and adding and subtracting modifiers according to  the Batters or Pitchers mastercard. The result will be one of: Strike or Ball, Hit, Infield Hit, Deep Hit, Line Drive Catch and Flycatch or Home Run. Special rule cover stealing bases and the bunt.

Name: Hurry Hard! The Curling Card Game
Description:
Hurry Hard! The Curling Card Game is a fun, fast paced card game suitable for curling fans of all ages.  Grab your teammates and take on your fiercest rivals to decide once and for all who really rules the ice.  Or go head-to-head against a fellow curler to determine who will be King of the Rings.

Playable by two, four, six or even eight players, Hurry Hard! recreates all the action on the ice in a fun, easy to learn card game.  Players take turns throwing guards, draws, or takeouts.  Your teammates can then improve the impact of your throw, including through the play of the powerful Hurry Hard! sweeping card to help get your rock a little closer to the button. Watch out though!  Your opponents can also affect your throw.  The timely play of a Miss the Broom card can ruin an end, unless you have a Plan B card in reserve.  After the player with The Hammer throws the last rock, the score for the end is calculated the same as in real curling, based on whose rocks are closest to the button.  Then a new end begins.

For non-curlers, the rules explain not just how to play the card game, but also the basic terminology to help you understand the game of curling itself.

For curlers, the game has been well balanced to reward real curling strategy.  Deciding when to throw a guard or when to come into the rings can make the difference between scoring a big end or giving up a steal.  Just as with real curling, though, no matter how good your strategy, you still need to make your throws.

Name: Alhambra: Queenie 1 – The Magical Buildings
Description:
Alhambra: The Magical Buildings, a promotional item from Queen Games for Spiel 2011, consists of six new tiles – one in each of the six colors of buildings – that are placed in the bag with the other tiles at the start of the game.

When drawn, they are placed for sale as with any other building. What's different about these buildings is that no direction is up, so when added to a player's Alhambra, the tile can be turned and placed in any legal position based on all the building rules except orientation. During scoring, these magical buildings count as a building of the appropriate color when determining majorities.

Name: Fresco: The Bishop's Favor
Description:
Fresco: The Bishop's Favor, a promotional item from Queen Games for Spiel 2011 and included in the Big Box and MegaBox, consists of 25 small tiles and rules.  The Bishop's Favor can also be referenced as Module 11.

At the start of the game, these tiles are placed face-down, randomized and placed one per fresco tile on the game board. Whenever a player completes a fresco tile where the bishop is currently located, the player claims both the fresco tile and the favor tile – which is revealed and grants an immediate reward of paint (red, blue, yellow), money (1 or 5), one VP, or one mood improvement.

If a player completes a fresco tile where the bishop is not located, the favor tile is removed from the game face-down with no benefit for anyone.

Name: Kingdom Builder: Capitol
Description:
Kingdom Builder: Capitol, a promotional item from Queen Games for Spiel 2011, consists of two capitol building tiles and rules.

If the game board sections with the harbor or oracle are in play, place a capitol building on one of the castles in that section. (If both are in play, you may use both capitols.) At the end of the game, you earn 1 gold for each of your settlements built within two hexes of a capitol.

Name: Steam: Map Expansion #2
Description:
Steam: Map Expansion #2 provides three maps in the same pack that can be used with the Steam base game. One side of the four-panel game board features a map of Great Britain suitable for 3-4 players that's subtitled "Progress from Canals to Rails". The other side of the game board has two maps, each covering two panels of the game board: California 2090 ("Gain Prestige but Prepare for Disaster" for three players) and China ("Unite the Country on the Floodplains" for 2-4 players).

Steam: Map Expansion #2 also includes an extra tile sheet for Steam.

Name: Crickette
Description:
Action game. The board consists of a length of baize, which is around 6 feet long. One player rolls a ball at the stumps (nice stumps and bails included)whilst the other player tries to hit the ball with his bat. The rules do not say how many runs are scored after the ball has been hit, you can decide for yourself.

The box suggests a date of around 1925 and it illustrates the game mechanic quite well. Note that the game is trying to appeal to adults (no children playing on the box image).

Name: Formen und Farben
Description:
Players roll the color-die and match game pieces in rolled color on their boards.

Player who finishes his picture first is the winner.

Contents:

     4 player boards
     24 game pieces punched out from the player boards with different colors and shapes
     color die

Name: 18NK
Description:
18NK is a Japanese 18xx game set in Nagaokakyo.  While the rules are as-yet-untranslated, it appears to be not dissimilar to the rest of its family - a combination of stock manipulation, route-building, and capital management.

A few details: there are 15 companies, and there appears to be some kind of "destination" system.

More details to come as translation efforts begin.

Name: 18SS
Description:
18SS is a Japanese 18xx game, apparently without a historical location.  While the rules are as-yet-untranslated, it appears to be not dissimilar to the rest of its family - a combination of stock manipulation, route-building, and capital management.

A few details: there are 14 companies, one central "big" city, highly variable off-boards.

More details to come as translation efforts begin.

Name: Pferde und Ponys
Description:
In English Horses and Ponies.
What you need to ride? Like a horse is kept? What you see in the horse show? With knowledge, some luck and a good memory players collect chips.

To win a chip player must be on any theme board, where the knob has posistioned so that the imaged symbol matches with symbol on one of the player's face-up picture card.

Player with the most chips at the end of the game is the winner.

Contents:

     5 theme boards, 
     5 knobs, 
     30 picture cards, 
     26 chips, 
     1 pawn, 
     1 stand

Name: Benjamin Blümchen: Karussellfahrt mit Törööö
Description:
Rolling the special die players move around the carousel collecting chips for his tray tables. If the special symbol is rolled all the characters must enter and take a spin with the carousel.

Player who has collected all 4 type of chips first is the winner.

Contents:

     A carousel (consisting of 2 parts)
     4 tray tables
     1 die
     4-Benjamin game characters
     16 chips (4 each in orange, red, yellow and blue)

Name: Tricky Trades
Description:
16 cards featuring images that are a cryptic clue for a profession of some sort. A hen walking away from her roost and leaving three bricks where her eggs should be, would denote a Bricklayer.
The cards are placed around the room before the party starts and when the guests arrive they are given a record sheet, on which they should write their answers when they come across a card.
The player with the most right answers at a pre-determined time, wins

Name: Treasure Quest
Description:
Party game.
Contents
18 Pirate cards
12 Treasure Island maps
The host places all the pirate cards (except card 1) around the room where they can be easily found and seen by the guests.He reads out the first Pirate card and players now look for the Pirate card next in sequence for their chosen route on their map card. When they find it they will be either right or wrong. If wrong, they must go back to their start position on the map. And play progresses like this until one player has discovered the exact location on their map card where the treasure is hidden. He or she wins.

Name: Cunning Couplets
Description:
Party game.
There are 12 Cunning Couplet cards and these feature couplets made up of two words that are not related. The 12 cards are placed around the room where players will be able to see them. Each player will have one word that is the first correct word to a couplet. They then look for another card that has a second correct word. For example, they know the word Turn, so they look around and evenutally find Coat, which makes Turn Coat. Now they must look for a word that goes with Coat and so on until they find a word that has Finish next to it. The first person to do this wins.

Name: So Tantalising
Description:
A box of three party games known as the Easy Chair Series of games.
In game 1 you have to try to follow a word square of 4 by 4 letters and so arranged they form the names of rivers. This type of game is similar in mechanic to Boggle.
Game 2 is Rhyming Pairs. You are given ten examples of question. The first information given is a word os short phrase. This is followed by a blank, then another blank and then a phrase again. You have to think of a word that goes into the first blank, thus forming two words 'with a close relationship'. Then you need to complete the second blank and make another word that links to the last phrase in your question. The trick is, the two blank words must rhyme. An example; A pool is the first word so the correct word to go with that is Lagoon. The last phrase is Very Light Ball and the correct answer is Balloon. Lagoon/Balloon is correct and rhymes.
Game 3 is a quick trivia game. You are given a grid of five by six boxes. Down the left hand side is a subject for each row, Countries, Professions, Flowers, Prominent People, Motor Cars and Boy's Names. You are given a letter and you must fill in as many boxes as you can with answers that begin with that letter.

Name: Garden Courtship
Description:
Party game, published under the Easy Chair Series of games by this publisher.
12 cards are distributed to 12 guests who want to play. The card takes the form of a story, with several blanks in them. You are given the first letter of the missing word and you must try to finish the story as it is read out by the host. All missing words are things that might be found in a flower garden. The most correct answers, wins.
An additional game is provided on the other side of the card and this is a simple Anagrams game. The first to get the 10 anagrams right, wins. All ten anagrams are names of motor cars.

Name: Popular Pairs in Pictures
Description:
Party game, another game in the publisher's Easy Chair Series.
Up to 12 guests are given a card and must write down any two things in the (rather nice graphics) picture. The two words must be related somehow. An example is given of Storm and Tempest being a close enough match. The guest with the most correct answers after time runs out, wins

Name: Im Fluge durch die Welt
Description:
Objective: 
Start from NY around the world

Simple 'Roll and Move' game: 
starting in NY, followed by South America, Africa, Europe, Asia and as traget back to NY city.

Name: Shingle's List
Description:
This ASL scenario pack consists of 8 tournament sized scenarios, 2 pages of historical background material, as well as British and Italian SASL generation tables.

The following scenarios are included:


    1: FACTORY FARMING; 25 January 1944; Aprilia, Italy
    2: FORMING THE THUMB; 30 January 1944; south of Campoleone, Italy
    3: TALLY HO!; 4 February 1944; south of Campoleone, Italy
    4: A PRODUCTIVE DAY AT THE OFFICE; 16 February 1944; Aprilia, Italy
    5: SPARKS FLY; 17 February 1944; Albano-Anzio Road, Italy
    6: HERE COME THE BASTARDS; 18 February 1944; Albano-Anzio Road, Italy
    7: EVERYTHING WE GOT!; 19 February 1944; Albano-Anzio Road, Italy
    8: GET READY; 29 February 1944; Carano, Italy

Name: Benjamin Blümchen: Wer braucht was?
Description:
With the help of Benjamin the Elephant children must match the pairs with different professions - one with the Benjamin in uniform and other with tools for this professions.

The smarter kid who finds out the most pairs is the winner.

Contents:

     12 pairs of cards, each card consists of a pair of Benjamin Blümchen card and a picture card

Name: It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia Board Game
Description:
Step into Paddy’s Pub with Mac, Dennis, Charlie, Dee and Frank.

All friends working in harmony for a common cause: themselves!

As a member of The Gang, you’re trying to purchase the most shares in Paddy’s Pub. You need to collect beers (tokens), make your way to a pub to convert them to empties, trade your empties for Paddy’s Pub Dollars at a beer store, and make your way to Paddy’s Pub Headquarters to purchase some shares.

Along your quest, don’t forget to ‘Bang the Waitress’ and backstab other members of The Gang with some Charlie Work!

Components:

•Game Board
•70 Episode cards
•64 Sunny cards
•42 Paddy's Pub Dollars cards
•24 Charlie Work cards
•20 Paddy's Pub Shares
•130 Beer tokens (26 of each 5 different types of beer/character)
•5 Game tokens (characters)
•5 Bang the Waitress tokens (also characters)
•1 six sided die

Name: Prestige
Description:
Prestige is a strategic placement game, in which two players compete to reach the power needed to bring their kings on the throne. The city of Nova is divided into four districts, each of which hosts a different power. It’s up to you to manage your family, by placing each member in a strategic position and choosing how and where to gain  either political, religious, economic or military supremacy.

A game of high strategy that will bring a growing challenge to the two contenders.

"Not all battles are won with weapons".


                                                        
                                                    
                                                
                                            
                                        
                                    
                                
                            
                        
                    
                
            
        
    


Prestige è un gioco strategico di piazzamento, in cui due giocatori si sfidano per conquistare il potere che condurrà i loro re al trono. La città di Nova è divisa in quattro quartieri, ognuno dei quali rappresenta una sfera d’influenza. Sta a te gestire la tua famiglia, piazzando ogni membro in un punto strategico e scegliere come muoverti per acquistare supremazia, che sia politica, religiosa, economica o militare.

Un gioco di alta strategia che porterà una sfida sempre diversa ai due contendenti.

"Non tutte le battaglie si vincono con le armi".

_________________________

PRESTIGE

The city of Nova, capital of a great kingdom, is now lost in big turmoil. The king is dead and the power vacuum is spreading. Two important families are going to take the field, ready to do anything for supremacy. A silent war is about to begin. The two queens, ruling their families, will lead their followers in the attempt to conquer Nova in strong and subtle ways through palaces, markets, strongholds and temples. Who will set up their own king on the throne?

Prestige is a strategic placement game, in which two players compete to reach the power needed to bring their kings on the throne. The city of Nova is divided into four districts, each of which hosts a different power. It’s up to you to manage your family, by placing each member in a strategic position and choosing how and where to gain  either political, religious, economic or military supremacy.

A game of high strategy that will bring a growing challenge to the two contenders.

Not all battles are won with weapons.

OBJECTIVE OF THE GAME
The players must install members of their own House in Key Areas of the four ruling districts in the city of Nova in order to exercise always more and more influence and gain Supremacy over the other House to finally put their own King on the throne.

COMPONENTS
House White        
1 King
1 Queen
1 Bishop
1 Knight
1 Rook
3 Pawns

House Black
1 King
1 Queen
1 Bishop
1 Knight
1 Rook
3 Pawns

36 Influence Tokens in different colours:
9 blue Tokens (Religious Power)
9 yellow Tokens (Political Power)
9 green Tokens (Economic Power)
9 red Tokens (Military Power)

1 Game Board is divided into the four ruling districts of the city of Nova, with four different Key Areas and a Secret Key Area in each district.

2 House Boards

Setting up the game
Open and place the Game Board at the centre of the table. Randomly pick up the first player. The first player will get all white pieces and will guide the White House. The other player will get all black pieces and will guide the Black House. Each player gets the House Board of his/her own House. 
Both players place their own King on the square marked with 0 (zero) on the Game Board. 
The player using Black gets one Influence Token of his/her choice.

Prestige is played over a series of turns. Each player’s turn has four consecutive steps. 
1. Acquisition
2. Ability Use 
3. Placement
4. Promotion

END OF THE GAME
If at the end of your turn you reach or gain more than 22 Supremacy Points, the opponent will play his/her last turn. The game ends at the end of that turn. At the end of the game each player gets Bonus Supremacy Points according to the following conditions:

Bold and Strong: +2 Supremacy Points if all of your Pawns are on the Board in any position at the end of the game.

Conformation: +3 Supremacy Points if you have at least one piece in three different districts in any position at the end of the game.

The player with more Supremacy Points is the winner. In case of a tie the player with more Influence tokens wins the game. In case of a further tie, the Black Player wins.

Name: 3 SPORT GAMES
Description:
Simulation of 3 sport games: soccer, basketball, hockey.

Players subsequently move all they players.

Soccer: Each player has 10 players and goalkeeper on the pitch. Goalkeeper cannot move out of penalty area. During each turn players can run with ball (max. 6 hexes), pass to another man (at most for 10 hexes) or shoot (max. 10 hexes). Each pass can be blocked if opponent is next to the line of the pass. If on the line of the pass - opponent always steals the ball. Rules saving a shot by goalkeeper are the same, but there's possibility to score the goal even if he's on the line of the shot. There are also tackles, fouls, outs and penalties, but no yellow/red cards.

Basketball: each player has 5 players. Players can move at most 3 hexes (no dice rolling), shoot, or pass. Defenders can steal a ball only during a pass or a shot (blocking it or rebounding), and if they're next to a player passing the ball or the one that catches it. There are steals, fouls and rebounds. Scoring is for 1, 2 and 3 points.

Hockey: each player has 5 players and goalkeeper. Goalkeeper cannot move out of the goal area. Moves, shoots and passes for maximum 6 hexes. All rules are combination of soccer and basketball rules written above.

Player wins after determined time or result. Producer recommends 2x30 min for soccer, 3x20 for hockey and 2x20 for basketball.

Mechanic: each action is decided by dice. In soccer - 1-2 dices, other sports: 1 dice.

2 sided board: on one side there's soccer pitch, on second - basketball and hockey.

Name: Color-Combi
Description:
Color-Combi is an abstract card placement game for 2-5 players.  The game is comprised of 70 square cards, each containing a multi-colored cross, and five sets of colored tokens, representing up to five players. The game is housed in a cardboard box with color printed top and unprinted bottom.  The box contains a plastic tray to hold the cards and the tokens.

Each player is dealt two cards, and the remaining cards form a draw pile.  The first player draws a blind card and then lays one card from their hand face up on the table.  Playing clockwise, each player takes a turn, drawing a card and playing a card on the table.  Cards must be placed, edge to edge, so the colors match.  Players must place a card if they are able, but rows of cards cannot exceed three cards in length.

The goal of the game is to create squares of cards and claim them with the colored tokens.  Additionally, your can seize an existing square if you are able to replace one of the cards on the table with a card from your hand.  The first player to claim four squares wins.  There are additional rules for a points game.

Name: Tricala
Description:
Tricala is a two- to three-player Kalah game played on a triangular layout of twenty-one pits (six to an edge).

Players alternate placing stones in whatever pits they choose to set the board.

As with conventional Mancala games, a player's turn consists of "sowing" stones: all stones are picked up from any cup containing at least one stone of the player's color, then stones are redistributed one-by-one along a line of pits leading away from the source. Unlike most Mancala games, [1] there are between two and six sowing directions to choose (depending on the cup), and [2] the direction deflects when a board edge is reached. Sowing is extended ("re-sowed") if the last stone drops into a pit containing only the active player's stones.

Stones are captured when the last piece sowed lands in a pit containing an opponent's stone.

The game is won when a player captures nine stones or claims the majority in each corner pit.

Name: Fantastic Flyers
Description:
45 playing cards divided into 15 Fantastic Flyers

Each player has 5 cards and is trying to make sets of 3 cards to make a flyer, by trading with the deck or the other players.  When a player makes a complete creature it is placed on the table.  The player with the most complete creatures is the winner.

The included flyers are Bat, Bee, Butterfly, Cockatoo, Cranefly, Dragonfly, Duck, Eagle, Flamingo, Ladybird, Owl, Pelican, Robin, Wasp, Woodpecker

Name: Yes & No
Description:
A game for larger group of players, in two teams, featuring words and definitions. At first glance the game offers a well-known standard mechanism, you must describe something to the members of your team, avoiding given taboo words, the team must guess the item or term.  A new feature introduced in Yes & No is that you also have a list of compulsory words that you must use. And this results in a completely different game.

Contents:

     game board
     Yes & No. 110 card
     1 timer (30 sec)
     1 dice
     2 characters

Name: Basil der grosse Mäusedetektiv
Description: The detectives win the game when they find out the secret code of a raid array before the first gangster reached this field. The crooks win when he reached the last box with the jewels. A gangster on the train rolls and moves accordingly, he moved to a secret map and places it among the questions on the next raid box. The detectives dice and move or ask a question with a card from the next raid.

Name: Monster Mash
Description:
Monster Mash is a turn based combat game for two or more players set in a world where kids can buy designer monsters as pets and have them fight each other in a global sports league. The game allows players to create and control one of several different types of miniature monsters. Monster Mash gives players complete control over the creation of their monster. Players can create an existing monster from popular media or one from their own imagination. The possibilities are endless. The object of the game is to beat any monsters that oppose you in the arena and win the match.

Monster Mash is a standalone game that can also be used as an expansion for any other Toy Battle SystemTM game.

Name: Buhu-Gespenster
Description:
The little ghosts floating through the castle and look for their missing toys, who is first to find all of his favorite things is the winner.

Players roll the die and try to place colored and shaped game-pieces on their cards. If the game-piece doesn't fit on player's card he can keep it and use next round in exchange.

Name: Benjamin Blümchen: als Zoodirektor
Description:
Benjamin Blümchen must represent the zoo director to check and count that there are correct number of animals at zoo.

The cards with the animals are stacked and covered with the Benjamin Blümchen card. The 12 animals at the zoo are placed easily accessible for everyone in the middle. The player whose turn it is draws the top animal card and all players look at it. 
The player who first recognizes which animal is missing or is too many, takes the animal figure from the table. Who gets the proper figure, receives the card. The beast goes back to the middle. If nobody got the right animal, the card goes out of play. When all cards are played, the child with the most cards wins.

Name: StockCar Jr. Racing
Description:
User Summary

StockCar Jr. is an auto-racing game. The object is to be the first player to complete 15 laps.

Players qualify for racing order with a dice roll. Car movement is controlled by rolling the dice as players seek to vie for positioning in "The Groove," an area of the track which allows for the fastest possible movement. But this is more than just a roll-and-move game...

Players can choose a car setup that's either Tight or Loose. A Tight setup is more conservative and safe, while a Loose set up gives more reward at the cost of greater risk. Players can also switch between high and low gear. Special rules cover cornering, getting "out of groove" and "out of shape," and accidents/collisions.

Another interesting feature of the game is the ability to collect Power Points. Cars can gain these when they are caught in traffic or have no legal moves. They can be used later to help with tricky maneuvers.

All cars pit after their 4th and 9th laps. Each car gets a Pit Card which indicates how long the pit stop is how many spaces of movement it gains while exiting.

The game comes in rather large "pizza box" style container with a checkerboard patterned cover.

Components include:
- A large gameboard with a track three spaces wide for the cars to travel on, 
- 2 sets of instructions,
- 6 sets of control tables which represent high and low gear for the Loose and Tight car setups, 
- 6 sets of gauges to track Power Point usage, 
- A color-coordinated pair of dice and wooden playing pieces for each of the six race teams (aka players), & 
- A set of 20 Pit Cards

Name: TUGG 2
Description: A "Tri-Level Game for Ages 7 to Adult" described on the side of the box as a "Fast Game of Fun and Strategy for Two".  The board has some similarities to that of games in the Morris family, though piece placement is guided by die roll.  The game's objective is to form sets of three pieces in a row, either via direct placement or via moving the pieces along lines on the board, with victory coming when a player reaches 16 points.

Name: The Pioneer Card Game
Description: In the mid-nineteenth century, the players lead their families into a new world, using a hand of cards to explore, develop, moderate the climate, and conduct other activities. In The Pioneer Card Game: Chapter resources, each player receives his own hand of cards, places them all in an order that he speculates will lead to good results, then executes these cards sequentially. Compete with opponents for resources and incentives, and lead your family to a new world...

Name: Bisca
Description:
The Bisca is a Portuguese variant of Briscola.  Like that other game, each player is dealt 3 cards and another one is turned up as the trump suit.

The first to play can play any card he wants to, but the second needs to play a higher card from the same suit previously played or a card of the trump suit to win a trick. The winner of each trick replenishes his hand first and a player owning a 7 from the trump suit can "rescue the bisca", taking to his hand the card turned up in the beginning of the match.

The total points in each game is 120 and whoever has the higher scoring wins. Playing with 3-6 players just takes a few minor adjustments to the rules or cards and the versions for 4-6 are played with partnerships.

The point system goes as follow:
Aces - 11 points
Fives - 10 points
Kings - 4 points
Queens - 3 points
Jacks - 2 points

Playing with a traditional spanish deck of cards is recommended but not mandatory, and the point system follows the same structure, with the "cavaleiro" (knight) card replacing the queen.

The game is usually played with a hand of three cards (Bisca de três - literally three's Bisca), but there are two variants:

Bisca dos Nove (Nine's Bisca) for a hand size of nine cards;
Bisca dos Sete (Seven's Bisca) for a hand size of seven cards.

Name: MIL (1049) Land Pack
Description:
Essen 2011 promotional land pack.

Include 3 new lands, rice field, linen field and mill.
Replace the starting food lands with some or all of those.
Families: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

Name: Trench
Description:
Each player starts with a shuffled stack of all cards from one suit (or two for a longer game). Players deal cards face-down into their own rows of front and back "trenches". A player may peek at his own cards anytime.

A turn consists of one of three actions:

     Reveal a card in the opponent's trenches.
     Swap positions of two neighboring allied cards.
     Attack: Flip two directly opposing cards. Discard the weaker card, and return the stronger card to the owning player. Each player slides a card from their back trench into the spot emptied by the attack and lays a replacement card in the back trench.


A player left with only three cards loses.

Name: Eduard Vilde kaardimäng
Description:
Cardgame made for Museum of Eduard Vilde.
Eduard Vilde was famous Estonian writer.(4th of March 1865 - 26th of December 1933).

There are 120 cards in this game: 60 green period-cards and 60 yellow creation-cards both in six time periods. There are questions on face-up and correct answer variant on face-down of the cards.
Cards are shuffled and put face-up stack in the middle of the table. Players/teams must answer the question of the top card in their turn and if the answer is correct they may keep this card. If this card is creation-card player/team must have also correct period-card to score a point.

Player/team who reach to prearranged score is the winner being "the most successful Eduard Vilde"

Name: Benjamin Blümchen: Lernabenteuer Auf Weltreise
Description: Benjamin Blümchen helps children learn more about our earth: the 6 continents, important monuments, people, animals, countries, and cultures. Depending on the game chosen, there are different ways to win, but always the flower forms must be placed correctly - this flower system allows control of the correct answers - the flowers only fit into one position.

Name: The New Era: Spiel 2011 Promo Pack
Description:
The New Era: Spiel 2011 Promo Pack, a set of seven cards available from Portal at the Spiel 2011 game convention, can be used in either The New Era or 51st State. Five hundred copies of this promo pack were produced.
Microbadge for owners

Name: Lauras Versteckspiel
Description: On the cards are motives from Lauras world, five cards are laid out face up, each player also receives 5 cards. The active player looks at the cards and tries to remember them, then he closes his eyes and one card is turned down. Now the player has 20 seconds to name the card correctly. If he is right he can place one of his cards face up on the table, if he is wrong a card from the draw pile is added. The player to discard his last card wins the game.

Name: Dein Volkswagen
Description:
Objective: Be the first to arrive at field 70

Simple 'Roll and Move' game; different editions - rare collector's item: communicates strong economical grow of
early W-German economy, remake of an elder KdF ('Kraft durch Freude')game - see images

Name: Birds!
Description:
From the Kickstarter description:

The game consists of two decks: the action cards and the event cards. The action cards make up your hand, and the event cards are played at the end of each each round in an attempt to "ghostify" your friends (a.k.a. kill them). Once a player has died, the game is not over for them! Players who die continue playing as ghosts, not able to win, but fully capable of messing with others.

The game is played in rounds. A round consists of players playing action cards, and a single player playing an event card at the end of the round. Players use action cards to draw extra cards or cause other players to discard in an attempt to favorably control the number of cards in players' hands, their own included. Events target players based on the number of cards in their hand, adding to the strategy elements of the the game. Some action cards also allow players to dodge events the main component of survival in the game.

The Kickstarter campaign failed to meet its funding goal on 27 November 2011.

Name: Play By The Book
Description:
An interactive literature-based game that uses ANY work of fiction.

The aim of the game is to get students talking and learning about literature.

Players move around a the illustrated game board, trying to reach THE END.  Students travel ahead by correctly answering the reading comprehension questions on the game cards and by responding to each other's viewpoints.  All types of learners are engaged through singing, acting, and drawing.

Name: Postman Pat's Giant Picture Card Game
Description: Over-sized cards for little fingers. 4 games featuring cards related to the TV favourite, Postman Pat. The games are as you would expect for a game aimed at very young children, Snap, Pairs; Memory; Happy Families.
Families: Theme: Mail / Stamps / The Post Office

Name: Aerial Combat
Description:
For its age, some quite clever ideas. Here are the important rules;

The game is intended for two players, one taking the 'planes' and the other the 'shells', both represented by discs.
The aim of the game is to get as many planes as possible through to the Objective. Each player moves in turn commencing with a Plane.
The Moves;
The discs move according to the number obtained by spinning the arrow. The exact number of places must be moved each time and only one disc for each move. Planes must be moved forward (never backward).
The red-circle shells move horizontal (sic) left or right only. The black-circle shell may move horizontal (left or right) or vertically (backwards or forwards) but not outside the green half of the board.
Shells can move only if the number of spaces to be moved brings the shell to a circle of the same colour as a plane in play.
Rules;
The planes' player moves any plane he chooses. He may try to reach his objective with one at a time or more if he so desires, but he must not forego a move if it is possible to move a plane the required space.
Shells may pass over planes but not over another shell.
Planes may pass over another plane or shell.
Losses;
A plane is hit (and thus out of the game) if it comes to a circle occupied by a shell or if a shell hits the plane. That is, if a shell is able to move to a circle occupied by a plane. A hit is also registered if a plane comes to one of the red circles in the yellow half of the board, provided the red line is connected with a circle of the same colour as the plane and this circle has a shell on it or a shell hits it before the plane moves on.
Now place the discs on the circles as marked taking care to put the black-circle shell on its appropriate circle.
If the arrow should stop dead on a dividing line, spin it again.

These rules make a little more sense when you look at the images. Note that it is never properly explained who wins. Does the planes' player win if he gets just one plane to the objective? Or more? I guess you need to make some 'house rules' before playing.

Name: The Smurf Game
Description:
The box top shows Smurfs riding logs which are floating down a river. The description from the inside game box: After a picnic in the woods, the Smurfs are on their way home.  In order to get back to their village, they will travel along the stone path and take shortcuts by riding a log up the river.  But watch out!  The sneaky Gargamel is traveling up and down the river in search of Smurfs!

Each Smurf gets two log tokens. Using a spinner, player move Gargamel up and down a river.  The Smurfs travel on a stone path, but can also travel up the river using a log token.  Running into Gargamel while on the river causes the Smurf to be chased out of the river, losing the log token for the rest of the game and moving back to the nearest river crossing. First Smurf to finish wins.

Contents:

     Smurf Gameboard
     5 Smurf Characters
     1 Spinner
     8 Log Tokens
     Die
     Instructions on box lid.

Name: Streets of London
Description: Card game about collecting sets but this has a twist in that sets are of unequal sizes, from 2 card sets to 5 card sets. The cards picture street characters in Victorian London, who call out their wares or services, such as "Oranges, two a penny". At the bottom of the illustration in this case, it says Oranges. The associated three other cards in this set say Two, A, and Penny.

Name: Mountaineering
Description: Simple roll and move game. The board depicts a mountain with the track running to the top. On the track are short-cuts and it will get more competitive because the track thins as it gets higher.It is a race to the summit. There are several pathways at the start of the game and quite a few obstacles to prevent the player from getting ahead.

Name: Operation Neptune
Description:
Operation Neptune is an Advanced Squad Leader Platoon Leader campaign game featuring the assault crossing of the Seine in France 1944 by the British 43rd (Wessex) Division, opposed by the German 49th Infantry Division.

The game includes the Campaign card, colour overlays for the village of Vernonnet, historical notes and comments by a playtester. In addition to the counters, you need ASL boards 2, 7 and 19 to play this game.

Name: Candy Wars
Description: A simple wargame designed to hand out at Halloween time.  The game consists of two cards, the rules, two dice, and some candy.  The candy forms the units with different types of candy having different special powers.  Defeated candies are eaten by the victor.

Name: Vehicles! A Supplement for Operation Squad: World War Two
Description: After fighting dozens of battles with your men, the time has come to deploy some armour!  Motorbikes, cars, trucks, armoured cars, half-tracks and tanks are ready to take part in your games and make them even more exciting.  But now the infantry have got some anti-tank weapons to face these steel monsters too...  The Rules are still fast and easy to learn so enrich your army with some vehicles and have twice the fun.

Name: World at War: Into the Breach
Description:
From the LnLP webpage...

"World at War seems to have everything. There are Cubans with SU-100s, South Africans with Oliphants, French AMX B-2s, T-80s with different armor factors, and a designer who seemingly ignores logic, but there is one thing that World at War is missing. That one thing is LOTS of American tanks. Into the Breach cures that. This expansion to The Untold Stories explores the Yank’s battle on the front line in the first days of the war. Now you get to fight with lots of Abrams, Bradleys, infantry, and even Sheridans. On the flip side of the tank, you’ll fight a mass of Soviets and Polish armor.

It’s great big fun, with some great big scenarios. There are 12 of them to be exact (unless you order the upgraded version with an additional eight scenario campaign), including an East German counterattack, West Germans on defense, and Amercans defending in depth, screening main forces, attacking, and counterattacking."

In other words, this expansion for World at War: The Untold Stories adds a lot of new scenarios while adding a lot of American and Soviet units.
Families: Series: World at War (Lock 'n Load Publishing)

Name: Miniature Golf
Description:
British golf game that can be played on a carpet.
Metal 'rings' are provided, each with a hole in the centre and a number. Place these rings around the carpet and then you putt the ball into the hole of Number one ring. When that hole is completed, putt towards Hole 2, and so on. The player who takes the least shots after all the holes have been played, wins.

Name: Octino
Description:
Easy to grasp high concept mind game (a math equivalent of Scrabble that is played like Domino).
 It teaches/applies the four basic math operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division) on various positive numbers. Future versions will contain also negative numbers, and fractional joiners (to form fraction numbers)

CONTENT:
Key game components are octagonal tiles with numbers in the center, equal signs, and half math operations between them (addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division), decimal joiners, and tile holders.  
Basic Edition contains: 33 Positive Tiles, 11 Joiners, and 2 Tile Holders.
Standard Edition contains: 66 Positive Tiles, 22 Joiners, and 4 Tile Holders.

GAME RULES:
Each player receives an equal number (6-10) of randomly selected octagonal tiles that he/she keeps hidden from other players on tile holders. The remaining tiles are kept in the bank face down.

One of the tiles from the bank is placed face up on the table. E.g. Tile no. 5 is placed on the table.

The first player makes a move by creating a math operation with his/her tiles by attaching them to the tile on the table. (E.g. The player that happen to have tiles 2 and 3 uses them to create the math operation 5-2=3)

The next player attaches his/her tiles to any number on the table creating his/her math operation. (E.g. The player that happen to have tiles 1, 4, and 7 may create the operation 14/7=2. (The double digit number 14 is created by placing joiner between 1 and 4).

The players take turns using up their tiles. The one who uses up all tiles first wins.

To prolong the game the players may take additional tile (or even 2 tiles) from the bank after each move

See. www.octino.com for more information

Name: How's That
Description:
Cricket game.
The board has 25 boxes, each marked with a number (runs) or an 'out' decision (Bowled, Stumped, etc.). A match consists of one innings by each player (longer games can be agreed at the start).
The first player to bat flips his 11 counters on to the board. If a counter is in a box with a number, it counts that many runs.  If a counter lands in an 'out' box, then that counter is lost. After scoring runs, the same player flips again and the same procedure is followed. As wickets are taken, less and less counters are used, until you have no counters at all and the innings is over. Then the second player has his innings.
The player who scores the most runs, wins.

Name: Bobs The New Bridge Game
Description:
The game parts consist of a Bridge with various arches. Each arch scores a different number of points. The Bridge is placed at one end of the table. The player uses the cue provided in the box (it comes in two halves which screw together) to propel a ball forward, with the intention to hit it through an arch and thus score points.
The components include six balls. The cue and the bridge are made of solid wood.
Described on the box as 'A Popular Colonial Pastime for Any Number of Players'

Name: Sokker-Shy
Description:
An action tabletop game. Very loosely connected to soccer.
At one end of the table you assemble a net and 5 hollow circles (called hoops). From the other end of the table, the players take turns to propel a ball towards the net, hoping to get it to settle in one of the hoops, thus scoring points. The propulsion of the balls is done by placing a ball into the bag provided and squeezing the bag so that the ball shoots out.

The box lid shows Dad and Son playing and is a good illustration of the game.

The winner is the one with the most points after a pre-agreed time.

Name: Electroulette
Description:
A simple gambling game. From around 1950, they obviously thought the kids would enjoy learning how to gamble because the box shows Mum, Dad, Gran and two young sons, all getting a thrill out of the 'race'.
The board is a large spinner with 6 numbers. It is connected to a battery and a set of 6 lights. There is also an area where you can place your bets. After all wagers are laid, the wheel is set spinning and as it does so, the bulbs will light up every time the relevant number passes a contact point. Eventually the wheel will stop and the last light bulb to be lit will remain lit and that is the number that pays out winning bets.
A game that seems devoid of skill.

Name: Le Jeu de Sante
Description:
Promotional game for Coca-Cola, published in French, in Canada.

A simple roll and move game along a track of 100 spaces. If you land on the special squares you must obey the instructions.

Name: Dick Tracy Target Game
Description: A shooting game. The gun shoots plastic 'bullets' with a sucker on the end. If you hit the target, your 'bullet' should stick to it. On the target board there are six scoring spots, where, if you hit inside one of them, you can score a number of points that range from 500 to 5,000.

Name: Who is Lu?
Description:
Who is Lu is an intriguing guessing game for 3-8 players with curious minds, wit and imagination. Whether the group knows each other or not, they're getting to know.

In each round only one person knows who is Lu: All other try with the given questions to find out who of themselves is Lu.

If you have a guess, you can put on a bet on a person. The earlier you bet you can choose amongst the best betting cards. Who bets later, has more information but probably also less points.

After each round of questions the mystery is solved by the player who knows. Each players pawn now moves forward (or backward when guessing wrong) on the board.

Content

121 question cards
     64 player cards
     8 betting cards
     3 reveal cards
     1 game board
     8 characters
     1 set of instructions

Name: Flip Football
Description:
Fast paced action game. The board represents the football pitch and it has lots of holes into one of which the football will settle. Object of the game is to 'kick' the ball, by means of the 'boot' then smartly tap the coloured ring on the 'boot' with the forefinger of the right hand. The ball will then rise and drop on to the playing field. A little practice will make you quite expert at this. A completely different game but the idea of catapulting the ball on to the board is reminiscent of games like Flying Hats. After a pre-agreed time, the winner is the one who has scored the most goals.

Playing instructions are inside top of box

The box image illustrates the game rather well

Name: Tom & Tina: Die geheimnisvolle Maske
Description:
A "point and click" adventure played in reality.

This is an interactive audio drama presenting the first adventure of Tom and Tina (two kids, about 9 and 12 years old).

The player (or the team of players) interacts by touching the material of the game with an electronic pen - the Tiptoi (not included in the game).

The Tiptoi narrates the aventure of the two kids and the players either decides what to do in critical situations or directs where the two kids should go and where to look for clues and hidden items.

The material consists of a house and its surroundings. The house can be "opened" to examine the rooms inside. Directional arrows are used to guide Tom and Tina through the adventure.

During the adventure the players will play about 10 mini games to succeed in the adventure. These minigames can also be played separately from the main adventure.

Name: Crocodile
Description:
Simple dexterity game, with all-wooden components: Crocodile, 1 die, 29 sticks in four colors and 29 disks in 4 colors.

Every turn a player roll the dice to find out what (s)he need to stack on the crocodile figure, which is a bit unstable. Players try to put as many sticks or wooden disks on the figure before it falls out of balance.

Name: Chaos Isle: Survivors
Description:
She was born from a cesspool of mutating Virus and Zombi corpses, a toxic pit dug by the Survivors to dump their defeated enemies in. She is the manifestation of Dr. Z's lixir, arisen to exterminate the Survivors and to make the walking dead her immortal slaves.

The remaining Survivors, the last of the living, finally band together in a last desperate struggle for survival and to rid the Isle of the Virus-Infected Undead once and for all.

Chaos Isle: Survivors is a 28-card Character Replacement Upgrade for Chaos Isle: Zombi Deck. The deck contains every Character ever made for Chaos Isle, six brand new Characters, and the all-devouring Brood Mother, a sort of anti-hero Character with her own set of rules. All cards have brand new artwork and design. Also included are rules for Outbreak: an entirely new way to play the game using strategic cooperative play, and Split Personality: a new way to enhance Mission-Based game styles.

Name: The "Dinkie" Bowling Game
Description:
This game was made by Spears in Bavaria around 1928-30. Sickeningly cute graphics.
Players roll balls at the doogie target and score either 2, 4 or 6 points for a successful bowl through one of the arches.
The one with the highest score after an agreed time, wins.

Name: Devil's Dice
Description:
Functionally a variant on Liar's Dice.  All players roll dice and begin a bidding round where players are trying to bid or bluff how many of a particular die face show under all players' cups.  A player may call a true bid (previous bid is exactly right), false bid (previous bid overstates the number present), or up the ante (new, higher bid than the previous bid).  Each player has one Devil's Die that can be altered by that player by one pip up or down when called out on a bid.

Box contents:
25 dice (20 red & 5 white)
5 dice cups
Rule sheet

Publisher Blurb:

A quick and easy to learn dice game, Devil's Dice is fun for all ages.  Players must attempt to deceive and bluff their rolls while guessing the intentions of their opponents.  However, each player must also contend with the Devil's Dice, which may win a round for them - or condemn them to certain loss!

Name: Acropolis of Athens: Following the Steps of Pausanias
Description:
Acropolis is a game for 2-4 players. Here each player has a short trip through the Athens and its monuments. Known and unknown paths and constructions wait for you to explore and collect them. The game is divided in 3 different Zones.

In each Zone each player tries to collect as many Monument Cards, as he can and through them you earn money, Gold Coins. Each Monument is designed on the board and is attached to 3 different step. So, if your pawn manages to step on all of them, then you can collect that Monumnet Card. Again, if you think is easy, you are wrong. Your rivals will make everything to stop you.

In the second Zone all the players follow a faster course trying to collect more Monuments. But here is the key. Among all of them there are some that have higher value and these Monuments will give you the victory!  During your speed trip, you will find many blocks since there are cards which send your pawn either back at the beginning of the Zone or at the end. You don't want that because when the race overs, you will have the less Monuments.

In the last Zone things get nasty. There only few important cards, that if you manage to collect them, then you secure your victory. At the end of that Zone, all of you count the points that your Monument Cards provide to you and add them together. The player with the most money wins.

Name: LeCoque's Intrigue
Description:
This is self-published Strategy level wargame based on Japanese TV animation "Fang of the Sun Dougram".
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fang_of_the_Sun_Dougram
This game cover independence war of planet Deloyer.

One player control planet Deloyer's peoples and other player control Earth Federation. Both players manage event card deck and military operations.
A game purpose of Deloyer player is achive to true independence, and Federation player is crush of independence movement.

Name: Infinite Power ECG: Gadget Archetype
Description:
The Gadget Archetype adds the tricky and resourceful Gadget cards to the IP ECG game.

The Gadget Archetype is great at evading conditions and ridding itself of Limitations placed on it by others.

New cards include;
Experimental Blaster
Utility Belt
Med Bot
Inspiration
Power Failure
and many more!
3 each of 20 new cards, a fully playable deck!

Remember that all cards in the IP ECG are interchangeable and allow you to mix and match cards from different Archetypes to make the super you've always envisioned.

Name: ATS:  Road to Bataan – Mabatang line 1941
Description:
From the Critical Hit webpage:

Welcome to the ATS ON THE ROAD TO BATAAN, a historical module that depicts the fierce fighting for the Abucay/Mabatang Line from 11-15 January, 1942. Situated on the on the Bataan Peninsula, this position ran through Mauban on the coast of Manila Bay (east side) to Mabatang on the coast of the South China sea. ATS ON THE ROAD TO BATAAN contains eight scenarios, all playable on the historical map included. You also receive a Battlefield Walkaround booklet plus a special set of counters. You get two sheets of the Philippine Scouts Personnel, all the vehicles and guns needed, PLUS A COPY OF THE JAPANESE FULL ATS SHEET  ... all the combat counters you need to play! Just bring markers, ATS Rulebook and play aids.

Name: Numis
Description:
Numis is a game that shows young people how money is made up.  The object of the game is to be the first player to get one quarter (25 cent piece).

The game consists of the board, one custom die and 'fun money' modeled after Canadian coins.  The board is illustrated with a stone pool, a barrel and a wheelbarrow.  Each player starts the game with 3 pennies (1 cent) and 1 nickel (5 cents). The rest of the 'money' is placed in the stone pool. Rolling the die tells the player to either place the specified amount of 'money' in the stone pool or take the specified amount from the stone pool.  Then the player must exchange their coins for a coin of larger value if they are able.  To do this the player places their coins on the wheelbarrow and takes the coin of equivalent value from the stone pool and places it on the barrel. When all the players agree that the two amounts of money are equal, the player takes the coin from the barrel.  The 'money' in the wheelbarrow goes into the stone pool.  Play continues until one player has enough change to get a quarter.

Name: Dis-Clue-Sure
Description:
This board game has been developed by Employers Reinsurance Corporation to have fun in learning actions that may cause errors and omissions claims.  Playing the game should harness the participants' spirit of competition, which is the lifeblood of the real estate brokerage business. - quote from the rules.

The object of the game is to reach closing of your listing and collect the most commission of any other player or team.  This is accomplished by moving around the board and answering question cards.  Correct answers gain money, incorrect answers cost money.

This is a teaching tool for real estate agents in game form.

Name: Square Off
Description:
Children's game to help develope spatial awareness.
Players draw tile and have to work out if it can contribute to the 6 tile pattern they have in front of them. As tiles can be any way up, this is quite a test for a young brain.
The winner is the one who completes his/her pattern first.

Name: Greyhound Race
Description:
A dexterity race game.
Each player chooses a greyhound (made of lead) and positions it at one end of the table. Each greyhound is attached to a length of string. The players stand at the opposite end of the table, holding the string of their greyhound. At the word "Go", each player jiggles their string, in the hope of making their greyhound advance towards them. The first greyhound to reach the players, wins.

Name: Ecoduel
Description:
EcoDuel © is a family board game developed by Solar Without Borders

EcoDuel is about the clash between the different forms of energy (coal plants, gas plants, nuclear, hydro, biomass, wind farms and solar parks). Pollution plays a crucial role. At first, Europe is completely green. Produce electricity by power plants pollute you with smog and black boxes are placed on the board. If you do nothing, in no time youe green areas turn black and you're out of the game.

Each player is the electricity supplier in a particular area and formidable businessman. Everyone is given the choice to switch to green power or conventional power plants to continue working. It remains important to earn your opponents out of the game. the game is a duel between Ecology and Economy: EcoDuel.

EcoDuel is a very interactive game. The game is full of potential strategies. Not only the construction of green plants can someone earn victory, but also resolutely choose to abandonment or polluting plants in your neighbor sites.

The winner is the one at the end of the game that has the most environmentally friendly area.

The materials used to realize the game are with an FSC label. The production of the game will take place as close to home for transport to a minimum.

The goal of EcoDuel one hand to raise awareness about the environment to enhance a wide audience in a fun and playful way. Promote green energy by bringing people together around a game. On the other hand, the goal is to generate funds for the development of Solar Without Borders

Name: Le Jeu Asterix
Description:
Play the role of Asterix, Obelix and sworn enemies of the Romans and fill in your mission to defeat your opponent! 5 missions 5 different games.

The game takes place in two stages ....
Early in the game, Gauls and Romans are preparing for the adventure in their respective camps. The Gauls are reservations of their magic potion and wild boar roasted while the Romans tried to form a powerful army of legionnaires. And they need it!

Once ready, we go for the adventure. Gauls and Romans out of their camp to compete in the forest. Random boxes "Combat" box and "Mission", players will find the best strategy to defeat their emnemis.

[The Gauls] win the game if they manage to kill all the legionnaires or that they fulfill their mission before the Romans.

[The Romans] took the victory if they succeed, a strong attack to deplete magic potion villagers OR if they perform their first mission.

Its been a long time since I have played it, but basically, you choose one of the 5 book that come with the game. [The golden sickle, Cleopatra,  Switzerland, The actress, and the cauldron.] Each has a different mission for the Gauls and the Romans. And each has a different type of combat when either player land on a combat square. It stars as a roll and move to collect potions or money. Then goes into another area of the board where there are miss a go squares, roll again, move to, secret passages...etc.
When you land on a Combat square, you go to another board where you do a dexterity game. The mission dictates the game. From knocking down Roman figures to flicking coins into the cauldron.
There are also some trivia questions about the Asterix book and a puzzle to form.


jouez le role d'asterix, d'obelix ou de leur ennemis jures les romains et remplissez votre mission pour vaincre votre adversaire! 5 missions 5 jeux differents.

Le jeu se deroule en deux temp....
En debut de partie, Gaulois et Romains se preparent pour l'aventure dans leur camp respectif. Les Gaulois font leur reserves de potion magique et de sangliers rotis tandis que les Romains tentent de constituer une puissante armee de legionnaires. Et ils en auront besoin!

Une fois prets, c'est parti pour l'aventure. Gaulois et Romains sortent de leur camp pour s'affronter dans la foret. Au hasard des cases "Combat" et des case "Mission", les joueurs devront trouver la meilleure strategie pour vaincre leurs emnemis.

[Les Gaulois] gagnent la partie s'ils parviennent a massacrer tout les legionnaires OU s'ils remplissent leur mission avant les Romains.

[Les Romains] remportent la victoire s'ils parviennent, a force d'attaque, a epuiser les reserves de potion magique des villageois OU si ils accomplissent en premier leur mission.

Name: Fame by Frame
Description:
Theme: Fame by Frame is a board game tucked in by the very veil of the seventh art, in which the players enjoy both the comfort and the privileges of being in the director's chair. Hiding behind pseudonyms inspired by the finest names of the director branch, their goal is to make the best movie possible, overshadowing the competition and ensuring their place on the boulevard of the famous.

In their quest for forming the best movie crew possible, they are assisted by a group of Agents using their own unique ways to collect actors and introduce their employer to various cinematic equipment.

Goal: Every player has the same goal--to have the most valuable movie crew at the end of the fifth round. The team's value is measured by calculating the points on the actor and cinematic equipment cards.

Game-Play: Players use various value Agent cards to get the best actors and equipment for their movies. Actor and equipment cards have victory points that determine the winner of the game, as well as special traits which can be used to help your agent get even more actors during the game.

Name: Galactic Adventure
Description:
Theme: You're in the role of interstellar pilots who belong to a secret organization OMEGA which should reveal where is the Star Gate, using artifacts - remnants of extraterrestrial civilizations, and only then the gate opens. When the gates open player to win the spacecraft Guardian stellar gate.

Goal: To be first player to defeat Guardian ship.

Mechanics: Every player at start of the game own very basic space ship. He must  upgrade it to Firefly version in order to find star gate and defeat powerful Guardian. 
In game players have opportunities to assume role of seven different duties from different side of law, which can help them to get money which is required for improvement of ship. Also players must explore universe which is different in every game, opening faced down cards which represent orbital sectors.
Fights is resolved using the dices on very unique way. Dealing and preventing damage according to values players previously assign to different values of 6 side dices, which represent their weapon.

Name: The Farm
Description:
Theme: In this game you play the role of a farmer who produces wheat, corn, pumpkin or apple and then takes the products to the market to sell. Your goal is to sell your products at the biggest price and earn as much money for your farm, taking care of farm field, weather and law of need and demand.

Goal of the game: Goal is to collect as much money as you can.
PLAYER AT THE END OF THE FOURTH ROUND WHO HAS THE MOST MONEY IS THE WINNER.

Mechanics: In the first stage players plant their Products card on the fields. There are seven fields with different values which grant different amount of crops planted on them. When the player in his turn draws a card from the deck card products, he looks it and then put that card on any of the fields. The player can place Products card on an empty field or on a field that already has products on the card itself, taking into account the following order.
Apples can be planted on a corn, corn can be planted over wheat, wheat can be planted over pumpkin and pumpkin can be planted over apples.
Crops get only the player with top card in the field when all Product cards are used.
In second part of the game players take products on market to sell. But must be careful if to many player bring same product price for that product will be very low.

Name: Vojvodina
Description:
Theme: Vojvodina, a Serbian northern province, famous by its agriculture, is called Serbian Granary.
Multicultural and multi ethnic, it is modern and developed region, but still, full of proud,agricultural people, tough and clever, as one should be to cope the challenges of growing
different sorts of crops, cope with weather, cope with, sometimes, unfair competition, and after all with the land itself... Are you clever enough to take the role of Vojvodinian PAOR – as they call their peasants, and try to be the most wealthiest paor at the end of the game?

Goal: At the end of the last round predicted for the given number of players, the game ends, and whoever has the most Money is the Winner of the game.

Mechanic: Game is played in two distinct phase. 
In first phase players make agreement with towns about supplying them with wheat, by drafting Town cards.
In second part of the game players lay their Fields tiles on common land trying to get most land for themselves, to plant as much as possible wheat and supply previously drafted Towns.
For every supplyed Town players get money but also for every unsupplayed Town player must pay fee.

Name: Guardians of light
Description:
Theme: Based on the motives of forest nightmares, Guardians of light are challenging and fun living card game, of combat skills, wisdom, adventure and fantasy played in battlefields of your minds where players desperately fight for their sanity.

Goal: To be first player to cross Dream road.

Mechanics: Each player takes 3 heroes that tries to cross the dream road as soon as possible. Dream road is made up of 5 cards, that is before him, set his teammate. The player whose heroes first cross dream road is the winner. There is no direct combat between players but there is plenty of strategy and impacts on opponents Heroes.

Name: Zoondo Bôplato
Description:
Zoondo Bôplato consist of a real playing board (not a paper board) and 8 new "terrain" cards for Zoondo.

There are 2 copies of each of the 4 types of terrain cards: Bananane, Dolwomen, Trempneu, and Glotrou.

Rules: Each player chooses 1 to 3 terrain cards from the face-down pile and places each one face-down on an open cell of the battlefield—without looking at the card.

During play, when a Zoon moves onto a cell with a terrain card, that player chooses one of the corners—each card has two "success" and two "failure" corners. If an enemy Zoon already occupies the cell, nothing happens.

Bananane (associated with the Monkus):

     Success: You can move your Zoon onto any cell adjacent to the Bananane
     Failure: Your opponent can move your Zoon onto any cell adjacent to the Bananane


Dolwomen (associated with the Boarix):

     Success: Your Zoon stops on the Dolwomen. As long as it remains on the Dolwomen, it gets +1 on its corners
     Failure: Your Zoon reverses course in front of the Dolwomen, similar to a fight ending in a draw (see rules: If your fight ends in a draw, your Zoon moves backward from the opponent one space in the direction from which it came)


Trempneu (associated with the Rhinogoths):

     Success: You can move your Zoon according to the grid shown on the Trempneu card
     Failure: Your Zoon stops on the Trempneu


Glotrou (associated with the Warus):

     Success: Nothing happens
     Failure: Your Zoon stops on the Glotrou and is flipped to its visible side. It can’t move and it fights with its visible side showing. You must use a complete move to flip your Zoon back to its hidden side

Name: Singularity
Description:
Played on the The Game of Y board.

12 stones of their own color for each player, arranged alternating around the perimeter of the board.

From the website "Taking turns, players move any one of their stones by 1, 2 or 3 unit spaces along an unobstructed line, in any direction. A stone may move in only a single direction on a turn. There are no jumps and no captures of opponent pieces. When a player's stone lands immediately next to a stone of its own color, in any direction, on or within the 15 nodes of the central triangular region of the board the moving stone captures the resting stone, which is removed from the board...

To be the first player to have only one stone remaining on the board, occupying one of the 3 central nodes."

Name: Aliens and Amazons
Description:
Played on the The Game of Y board.

From the website;

"One player (the Amazons) uses 30 black stones; the other (Aliens) uses just 3 white. Board empty.

Play:   The players take turns placing one of their stones on any unoccupied node. White (the aliens) plays first. After all 3 white Aliens are on the board, they begin moving. The Amazons do not move until all 30 are on the board. While the Amazons are still being placed, they may be captured and removed from the board by being jumped over by Aliens.

Moving:   Stones move one unit in any direction along lines to any unoccupied adjacent node. Amazons may not jump over other pieces, either Aliens or Amazons, and may not capture Aliens. An Alien may jump over an Amazon, if the node immediately on the other side of the Amazon on the same straight line is unoccupied, and the jumped-over Amazon is removed from the board. Multiple jumps and captures of Amazons by an Alien are allowed.

Goals   The object of the Amazons (Black) is to block and immobilize the three white Aliens, thereby winning the game. The object of the Aliens (White) is to capture a sifficient number of Amazons to eliminate the possibility of being blocked and immobilized, thereby winning the game.

Name: Sexta
Description:
Played on The Game of Y board

From website

Start:   6 stones for each player of their own color, arranged on the perimeter of the board as shown at left.
Play:   Players take turns moving any one of their stones any distance along an unobstructed line, in any direction. Movement through a pentagon may follow either of the two forks that exit on the other side.

Goal:   To be the first player to form a line of six adjacent stones. The line need not be straight as long as no stone has more than two neighbors.

Name: Enid Blyton's Journey Through Fairyland
Description: Simple roll-and-move game.  Players are one of the 'Adventurous Four' and compete to be the first to reach the end of the rainbow.  Characters from Enid Blyton's stories help and hinder players' progress via 'Good Magic' and 'Bad Magic' cards along with special squares printed on the board.

Name: Turbino
Description:
Turbino is a spellbinding new blowing game. It's easy to blow the propeller into motion, but its not easy to control it to stop at a specific square. The game contains 2 picture circles with different degrees of difficulty.

The objective of the game is to blow the propeller and also stop it (You can't touch it!) so that the arrow points a picture You don't have already. Then You may put Your rubber ring next to this picture. Player who first gets his rubber rings next to
every picture on the cirle wins the game.

Name: Moustaches
Description:
The Gentleman's Game of Facial Hair-Raising Thrills!

Grow and maintain the facial furniture of you most fertile fantasies! However, be sure to prevent your most gentlemanly of growths from evolving into an ungainly beard!

Be the first to score a 'Gentleman's Dozen' and win the most riviting card game of the era!

Accumilate the desired number of points by strategically laying 'Moustache' cards (each with their own, justified, density ratings) whilst blocking your opponent's moves with 'Beard' cards.

Take full control of the playing field by harnessing the use of 'Grooming' cards such as the 'Wet Shave' and 'Open Flame'.

A quick fire, point accumilation game with its tongue set firmly in the the cheeks of the 19th century!

Name: Dallas
Description:
This is an updated version of Cartel by the game's original designer, Philip Orbanes.  In the late 70's Phil had added a game of random event cards to Cartel to add variety to the game.  In Dallas, those cards are added, the board is also slightly changed in the new theme, which is based on the Dallas TV show.

Players take turns bidding on and buying companies on the board.  Larger networks of adjacent companies create higher payouts.  Players can also risk taking on debt to pay higher prices, hoping the resulting network pays for the liability of the debt.  A deck of random event cards adds a random element, "Dallas Press Events," to each turn (making the game different from the original Cartel).

The winner is the player that acquires the highest net worth, adding together current cash plus the value of their network of companies, less the cost of repaying their debt.

While the game has a theme based on the popular TV shows, only the companies, e.g., Ewing Oil, appear in the game.  A very few of the characters are mentioned in flavor text that appears in the rulebook.  None of the stars of the show are pictured and the graphic design does not pick up on the TV shows look and feel either.

Name: Astronaut, The New Game of Outer Space
Description:
Space age card game designed by Truman Rothfus of Des Moines, Iowa, designed when space exploration was a 'brave new world'.
Played with 72 illustrated cards, with players contracting to build and launch rockets into orbit.
Collect cards to build your rocket's features and then try to launch it by playing alternative cards. Other cards allow you to raise funds, sabotage another player's cards and so on. The rocket cards are in three stages. When you have your chosen three cards, they can be laid end-to-end and you get a nice example of your rocket from the tail up to the cone.
Box proclaims "Exciting! Takes You from Base to Space!"

Name: Motor Racing
Description: Simple roll and move race game in the grand British tradition of such games. The track has certain spaces that can help or hinder movement and the instructions thereon must be obeyed.

Name: The Little Ghost Game
Description:
'An exciting game for boys and girls' says the box. The subject matter is probably related to the appeal of the comic book character Casper the Friendly Ghost without being an actual Casper linked game. Dates from the early 1960's.
A spinner regulates players' movement and also indicates which part of the house is being haunted. The board represents four floors of an old house, from the cellar to the attic.
Wooden pawns and a built-in spinner (next to the play-area of the board).

Name: Helter-Skelter
Description:
A game completely devoid of skill. Players roll a ball down a curling slide (as in a Helter-Skelter ride in a funfair). The ball scores points depending on which hole it settles into, rather like in a Bagatelle-type game).

The box depicts an aged gnome standing on a ladder and about to start a ball rolling whilst two children look on. Not sure why a gnome should be associated with the game!

Name: "Ole" Thousand Face
Description:
Promotional game made by a chocolate manufacturer.
The game consists of five rectangular boxes, printed on all sides, that combine to make funny faces. Play consists of collecting the various components to make a face. Described as a parlour game,  the game is in the grand tradition of British games like Mis-Fits and American games like Mixies.
The box was originally filled with chocolates.
The illustrator, Carey Orr, was employed by the Chicago Tribune as the creator of the Kernel Cootie comic strip.
